boone

Class Link

  • java.lang.Object
    • boone.BrainPart
      • boone.Link
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Storable, java.lang.Cloneable
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    SpikingLink

    public class Link
extends BrainPart
implements Storable
    An un/directed link from a source neuron to a sink neuron. If the undirected flag is set, source and sink are interchangeable.
    Version:
    $Id: Link.java 2294 2016-04-18 11:38:16Z helmut $
    Author:
    August Mayer, Helmut A. Mayer

    • Constructor Detail

      • Link

        public Link()
        Create a new, uninitialized Link. The link weight is initialized with a random value in [ -1, 1 [. You need to add the Link to the NeuralNet object, after creating.

      • Link

        public Link(Neuron source,
            Neuron sink,
            double weight)
        Create a new link, and add to the link lists in the source and sink neurons. You need to add the Link to the NeuralNet object, after creating.

    • Method Detail

      • clone

        public Link clone()
        Returns a semi-deep copy of this object. Sets the source and sink neuron of the clone to null. Note that the name is taken without change from the cloned neuron.

        Overrides:
        clone in class BrainPart
        Returns:
        a semi-deep clone

      • getSource

        public Neuron getSource()
        return the source

      • setSource

        public Neuron setSource(Neuron source)
        Sets the link's source neuron. The involved neurons' link lists are updated.
        Parameters:
        source - the new source of the link, may be null
        Returns:
        the old source, may be null

      • getSink

        public Neuron getSink()
        return the sink

      • setSink

        public Neuron setSink(Neuron sink)
        Sets the link's sink neuron. The involved neurons' link lists are updated.
        Parameters:
        sink - the new sink of the link, may be null
        Returns:
        the old sink, may be null

      • getValue

        public double getValue()
        Returns:
        Value of property value.

      • setValue

        public void setValue(double value)
        Parameters:
        value - New value of property value.

      • isUndirected

        public boolean isUndirected()
        Returns:
        whether this link is undirected.

      • getDeltaWeight

        public double getDeltaWeight()
        Returns the last weight change.
        Returns:
        the last change value

      • reset

        public void reset()
        Resets internal link attributes.
        Overrides:
        reset in class BrainPart

      • randomize

        public void randomize()
        Sets the link weight to a random value in [-0.1, 0.1).

      • randomize

        public void randomize(double min,
                      double max)
        Sets the link weight to a random value in [min, max).
        Parameters:
        min - the minimal random weight
        max - the maximal random weight

      • disconnect

        public void disconnect()
        Disconnect this link, i.e. remove from the source and sink neurons.

        NOTE: You also need to remove the Link object itself from the Neural Network; better use NeuralNet.removeLink(Link) instead.

      • propagate

        public void propagate(Neuron n)
        Propagates the output of the given neuron over the link, if this link is an output link. Does nothing, if this link is not an output link.
        Parameters:
        n - the sending neuron

      • getOtherNeuron

        public Neuron getOtherNeuron(Neuron neuron)
        Get the other neuron of the link. Especially interesting with undirected links. If the given neuron is neither source nor sink, this function returns null. This comparison uses the == operator, testing for object identity.
        Parameters:
        neuron - the one neuron
        Returns:
        the other neuron. For example, if the given neuron is the source neuron, this returns the sink neuron.

      • replaceNeuron

        public void replaceNeuron(Neuron oldNeuron,
                          Neuron newNeuron)
        Replace the given old neuron with a new neuron. It doesn't matter whether the neuron to be replaced is the source or sink neuron. If the old neuron is neither the source or the sink neuron. this method does nothing.
        Parameters:
        oldNeuron - The neuron that is to be replaced.
        newNeuron - The neuron that should be put into place instead of the old neuron.

      • replaceFrom

        public void replaceFrom(Link oldLink)
        Replaces the given old link with this new link, i.e. initialize source and sink neurons. Also sets the old neuron's source and sink neuron pointers to null.

      • getWeight

        public double getWeight()
        Returns:
        Value of property weight.

      • setWeight

        public void setWeight(double weight)
        Set the weight to a new value. Note that the weight can also be changed using addToWeight(double).

      • addToWeight

        public void addToWeight(double deltaWeight)
        Adds the given value to the weight.
        Parameters:
        deltaWeight - the value to be added

      • isInputOf

        public boolean isInputOf(Neuron n)
        Indicates if this link is an input of the given neuron. Note that a link may be input and output link, i.e., a self-link.
        Parameters:
        n - a neuron
        Returns:
        true, if input link

      • isOutputOf

        public boolean isOutputOf(Neuron n)
        Indicates if this link is an output of the given neuron. Note that a link may be input and output link, i.e., a self-link.
        Parameters:
        n - a neuron
        Returns:
        true, if output link

      • setUndirected

        public void setUndirected(boolean undirected)
        Sets the direction flag.
        Parameters:
        undirected - true, if no direction, i.e., both directions
